Text:
Are you sure there's a secret entrance around here?
Can we even trust intel coming out of the MNA?

...Is it just me, or have you been a little harsh on
me lately, Epsilon?
No...not at all. You're imagining things.

If you say so—but the intel from the MNA is reliable
and should be utilized.

After all...the Sacred Land of Lindwurm is of course
one of the sites in the Holy Teachings venerating the
Goddess Beatrix.

It has also developed into a major city second only
to the Midgar Kingdom since the construction of the
reservoir dam, which maximized its abundant water
resources.

The dam's development also consisted of improving the
Sacred Land's water and sewage systems and building
multiple aqueducts throughout the city.

As a result, the number of underground facilities—
large and small—increased at an accelerating rate to
the point where no one could keep track of them all.

So when it comes to finding the Cult of Diablos'
hideout...it would be inefficient to search blindly
amongst the numerous facilities for a "hit."

...It makes sense in theory, but there's no guarantee
the MNA isn't somehow connected to the Cult, is
there?

In that case, you may as well claim any number of
groups—large and small—are under the Cult's
influence...

...so long as the Cult of Diablos continues to exert
their diverse influences in various places from the
shadows of history.
Well...yes...I guess you're right, Beta.

But despite being under their influence, attitudes
are many and vary drastically—some groups maintain
distance while others closely align themselves with
them.

And although the MNA had acquired intel on the Cult
it was never able to go public with it, still—
...Wait, you mean they're just sitting on this intel?!

Their archives are a treasure trove of intel that
should have been immediately destroyed. If the
Cult were to find out about it, things would not
end well for the MNA.

Of course, the intel is under tight control so that
even insiders can't gain easy access...but that
wasn't an issue for me.

I'd ask Gamma to buy up the MNA immediately if it
were financially feasible.

...And here we are. This is it. Shift this lamp post
to the right, pull it down, and—
What! Incredible...

Well...this is the entrance to the Cult of Diablos'
secret facility.

Zeta is on watch duty—signal her to join us. Let's
commence our investigation and extermination.
Understood!
...What?! Where did you—
Aghh...!
...Looks like someone was slacking off.

I'm sure anyone spending their days guarding an
entrance undetectable from the outside would
eventually start to get lazy.

...Hold on. There are tracks running through the dust
on the ground—wheel tracks.

Up ahead...it leads to a downward slope instead of
stairs.

Don't tell me they're transporting the possessed
here!

It would be a bold move to have a base for retrieving
the possessed within the city...but it's plausible from
a practical perspective.

We may be able to rescue the possessed. Good call
having you come along, Epsilon.
Huh...?

...W-Well, I guess. You know what they say, "Better
safe and happy." The cure should go smoother with me
here.
Pretty sure it's "Better safe than sorry."

Let's split up. Epsilon, Zeta, you two follow this
trail and see where it leads.

If you find the possessed, please protect and cure
them if possible.

I'll continue investigating the hideout and taking
out any Cult members I encounter.
Got it.
Very well...but will you be fine on your own, Beta?
Yes, of course! Let's begin the mission!

"Heheh. Don't worry. What I'm about to ask you won't
require fighting or exploring."

(Regardless of what Lady Alpha said... In my story,
I fight.)

(When I first picked up a sword, I was so afraid of
killing my opponent that I would always cower and
tremble.)

(But I'm not the same person I was then. I will
unlock my story's future...with my own hands!)
Aghhh?!
What! An intruder—
Too slow!
Ugfff...!

Take them unawares and slaughter them. That's right—
Lurk in the shadows and hunt down my prey!

There doesn't appear to be any intel or records of
interest here.

Hopefully, Epsilon and Zeta are having better luck on
their end—huh?!

A paladin of the Church?! But what a strange-looking
helmet...
Chhhh...kuhhh...
(This paladin... Wait, is he even a knight at all?!)
...Kuhhh...chhhh...

(There's no hesitation in his stance. He's undergone
advanced combat training and under high intensity.)
Hyah!
Huh?!
Kuhhh...chhh...

(He skillfully brushed aside my attack using little
magic!)

(How he wields magic is distinctly different from any
other Cult soldier. And unlike your average dark
knight, his deployment and release are on point.)

(Just the slightest lapse in control, and his defense
would be paper-thin against my magic attacks. And
yet...)
Shh...!
Ack!

(He's aiming his attacks at my vital points with
deadly precision, as if...he was an assassin!)
Chhhh...kuhhh...
Who the hell...is he?!
